result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan C Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan C Willis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan C Willis was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: FIRST 10 Days are Straight Time, Balance with Huber, release for standard conditions. Sentence credit of 1 day was granted if imposed.
Court would review petition to terminate probation after 10 months.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Sign Medical Releases for agent. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Complete an Anger Management Program and Cognitive Thinking Course within the first 10 months of probation.

No Violent contact with Ashley L. Maintain/obtain full time employment. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within the first 10 months of probation, as directed by agent.
